did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Center for Housing and Environmental Studies records, 1950-1969.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Cornell University. Center for Housing and Environmental Studies. Director.

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, project reports, accounts, speeches, publications, and committee records of Director Glenn H. Beyer of the Cornell Center for Housing and Environmental Studies.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, project reports, accounts, speeches, publications, and committee records of Director Glenn H. Beyer of the Cornell Center for Housing and Environmental Studies.

descgrp.head: INFORMATION FOR USERS

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Center for Housing and Environmental Studies records, #53-4-1308. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

descgrp.p: Digitized copy of "The Cornell Kitchen" can be found online here: https://ecommons.cornell.edu/handle/1813/40835

scopecontent.p: "The Cornell Kitchen" was produced by the Reynolds Metal Company. It was written by Jerry Gammon; Technical Advisor: Professor Glen H. Beyer; Cinematography: Vitali V. Uzoff with Assistant Cameraman: Andrew C. Fain and directed by Vitali V. Uzoff. This film outlines efforts to improve and modernize the kitchen.
The “original” film restored and maintained in the Reynolds Metals Company collection at the Virginia Historical Society.
